reviewText: Excellent material, excellent music, and just flat-out excellent DVD. I'm not a fan of screaming vocals but am a fan of female-fronted bands. What sold me to Arch Enemy was the adding of "Angela Gossow", and the melodic virtuoso guitars of the "Amott" brothers. I'm a big fan of female-fronted metal bands in the gothic/symphonic genre, so death metal is not my cup of tea but the melodic guitar work of the "Amott" brothers is so addictive.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a big fan of the early era of Arch Enemy.  They were able to deliver solid metal music and where able to do it live as well (one of their concerts at the Troubadour Los Angeles during the release of Anthems of Rebellion was incredible).This DVD caught the band in a solid live performance while providing good quality sound and filming.  Must have!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I havn't even seen the extras on this DVD yet, but the most important part is the concert footage & that is truly what makes this DVD worth picking up! All I have to say is that if you are one of those Arch Enemy fans that have bashed Angela since she joined the band to really give this DVD a watch & maybe you will be convinced that she really does have what it takes. The other thing is I'm not quite sure if there is overdubs because the concert sounds THAT GOOD; if it's pure Arch Enemy, then WOW! Arch Enemy has only become stronger over time folks; watch this DVD & you'll see what I mean.

reviewText: This is a must have for all Arch Enemy fans, this DVD is great & packed with some good features!

reviewText: What can I say. It's Arch Enemy! This dvd is sick and brutal! The live stuff is killer and the camera work is great! Arch Enemy can really whip a crowd into a frenzy! Anyone who has seen them live in person will tell you that! Including myself, I have had the honor of witnessing the destruction three times. I just got it so I haven't checked everything out yet, but I'm sure it's sick! The live stuff alone is well worth it. But this dvd has more for you. Interviews, life on the bus, touring, videos and so on. This dvd is better than slayer's dvd, War at the Warfield! Don't believe me? Get this and see for yourself. You won't be able to stop banging your head. All hail the ENEMY! Buy it, Buy it, Buy it, Buy it, Buy it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Whoever thinks that a metal band should not be fronted by a woman is either very close-minded or got his butt whooped by a woman, or both. Arch Enemy is a good example of a band with a frontwoman who can hold her own onstage, and knows how to whip the crowd into a frenzy while the music just rips their heads off. The extras are plentyful as you get interviews, behind the scenes of the making of the My Apocalypse video, behind the scenes tour footage, music videos, and even footage of drummer Daniel Erlandsson and guitarist Michael Amott discussing the gear they use. The main concert itself however is what makes this worth getting. The sound is just simply amazing. Every riff, cymbal, bass hit, etc. is crystal clear. Note that when Andy Sneap is involved in recording and/or mixing processes for cd's and dvd's, most likely it's gonna be sick. I can't stress that enough. He adds a bit of grittyness to recordings and makes it sound brutal. Arch Enemy fans won't be disappointed.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Arch Enemy, one of my all-time favourite bands, have outdone themselves with their first DVD outing. The band are on top with this "Swedish Apocalypse", keeping the powerful melodic death metal anthems coming. Angela Gossow is simply one of the most fantastic vocalists ever, and she shows us exactly why here, she's just relentless the whole way through (especially nailing the deep growls like a beast). As for Chris, Mike and Daniel (and even Sharlee), there's nothing more to be said. The guys are all musical prodigys, and it shows when it's solo time.This DVD contains just about everything you could want - a vicious live performance with DTS audio that'll crack your skull and eardrums, some fresher performances added onto that, all the music videos (at that time - including an alternate director's cut of Nemesis), really solid interviews with the band and some fun touring segments. There's even a little poster to hang up on your wall (at the time of writing, mine's still up there).See why Arch Enemy are the reigning kings of modern death metal - their skill and impact is never less prevalent than here, and this is all BEFORE the fantastic albumRise of the Tyrant. The DVD is packed, the audio and video quality is simply killer and this is ultimately one of, if not The, best live show you'll ever see on DVD.
Title: N/A

reviewText: ...Just WOW ! I thought I had seen it all when i saw the Dream theater at Budokan DVD...killer live performance,great visual and audio recording,tons of entertaining extra's...evrything,but this DVD beats the Budokan one.There is not a single weak track here...Killer riffs,mindblowing solo's and most of all DANIEL ERLANDSON ...all captured in superb cinematic angles and crisp sound.The bonus disc is fun,esp the candid interviews bit...Sharlee is a funny guy,Angela comes across as a very warm and intense person...all in all,its a blast.
Title: N/A
